issue.title: Allow for excluding views from listTables()

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Adds an option to listTables in Cake\Database\Schema\Collection to allow for excluding_views from a list of all tables. It seems like in many cases it's helpful to get a list of ALL tables and views together, but in the case of dropping all tables, then it's better to only work on a list of all the actual tables.

Closes #16122

body: Are you creating views in the schema sql loaded by SchemaLoader?

> 

Yea, the schema file includes views from the main application database's dump file. I'm not sure it makes a difference because the views are critical to the app functionality and would need to exist in the database no matter what during the test database recreation process where this error is triggered. As you have seen, there's further discussion in the PR thread.

Now that I've separated this from the separate but related issue in migrations, are you not able to tweak your SQL dump to do what you need? If your schema dump is created with `DROP IF EXISTS` style statements that manage your schema in the way you want, then you can disable drop & truncate using the paramters.

```php
(new SchemaLoader())->loadSqlFiles('path/to/schema.sql', 'test', false);
```

Using a schema file implies you want a high level of control or need to use platform specific features. You're using the expert mode APIs so you might have to do a bit more work.

I started with SchemaLoader just to get some basic unit tests setup and I eventually want to move my project to use Migrations. It's not clear yet if I'll be able to do that, since there are some idiosyncrasies to the schema. 
I think I've inferred that this new, third parameter in loadSqlFiles is an array of tables/views to skip? FWIW, in our use case there's not an insignificant # of views which would be annoying to keep track of if SchemaLoader becomes the permanent solution. So, still hoping the changes we're working on the linked PR will be helpful / relevant!

The third parameter isn't an option/array yet. It is a boolean that when false disabled table drop SQL being generated by `SchemaLoader`. My suggestion was for you to change your SQL dump file that contains your schema to include `DROP IF EXISTS` statements where necessary.

>  I started with SchemaLoader just to get some basic unit tests setup and I eventually want to move my project to use Migrations. It's not clear yet if I'll be able to do that, since there are some idiosyncrasies to the schema.

You don't have to use migrations if it doesn't work for your project. You can also build a wrapper for the existing tools you're using to create/modify your schema.

issue.title: Questions on the test suite lights in CakePHP 4.3

repository.name: cakephp-test-suite-light
repository.description: A fast test suite for CakePHP applications

issue.body:
Hallo there,

I have a problem when updating to Cake 4.3. 
We are using Fixture Factories 2.5.1 and test-suite-light 2.4.

Problem:
The tables are not emptied between tests, since the triggers  are not created in the database.
After some evaluation, the Sniffers truncateDirtyTables() method is called, but createTriggers() is not.

We are using a MariaDB database, so I used the MysqlTriggerBasedTableSniffer in my DB config.
'tableSniffer' => '\CakephpTestSuiteLight\Sniffer\MysqlTriggerBasedTableSniffer',

Note: I already had the problem on Cake 4.2 and before that the triggers were not created automatically.
Therefore I had created the triggers manually on the database. That worked.
With the update, this workaround no longer works. 
The triggers are now deleted when the test is executed, since the DB schema is created anew each time by the schema generator.

Would appreciate any help.
Thanks.
